reference.title: TestNetworkConfig
reference.shortdesc: You can use the TestNetworkConfig method to test that the configured network settings match the network settings being used on the system.

section.p: When you configure a node with the SetNetworkConfig method, in the UI or TUI, the configuration is validated and stored. The TestNetworkConfig API test uses the stored configuration for post-validation logic. For example, in the event of a power outage or network failure, you can use this API method to ensure a node is running with the most currently stored network configuration. This validates that there are no errors in the configuration and that the current configuration is in use.
This test is designed to only show failures in the response output. If there are no errors, this test does not return any output. See the following response examples.
section.title: Parameters
section.p: This method has no input parameters.

section.title: Return value
section.p: This method has the following return value:

row.entry: Contains any errors found when validating the currently stored network settings with the running network configuration.

section.title: Request example
section.p: Requests for this method are similar to the following example:

section.title: Response example 1
section.p: If no errors are detected, then no responses are returned.
